Package de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch

Class BatchInternal

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.BatchInternal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Batch
public class BatchInternal extends Object implements Batch
Internal implementation for OpenGL batch management that gives OpenGL (& OpenGL ES) - based BatchRenderBackend implementations some default functionality to avoid having to reinvent the wheel and to prevent unnecessary code duplication. Fully OpenGL ES compatible - this class doesn't require the implementation of any OpenGL methods that are not available in OpenGL ES. This implementation will be the most backwards-compatible because it doesn't use any functions beyond OpenGL 1.1. It is suitable for both mobile & desktop devices.

    • canAddQuad

      public boolean canAddQuad()
      Description copied from interface: Batch
      A batch can only hold so many quads. This will tell you when the batch is full. The amount of vertex data that a batch can hold is implementation-specific.
      Specified by:
      canAddQuad in interface Batch

    • addQuad

      public void addQuad(float x, float y, float width, float height, @Nonnull Color color1, @Nonnull Color color2, @Nonnull Color color3, @Nonnull Color color4, float textureX, float textureY, float textureWidth, float textureHeight)
      Description copied from interface: Batch
      Adds a quad to the batch for later rendering with Batch.render().
      Specified by:
      addQuad in interface Batch
      Parameters:
      x - The top left coordinate of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      y - The top left coordinate of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      width - The width of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      height - The height of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      color1 - The color of the quad's first (top left) vertex.
      color2 - The color of the quad's second (top right) vertex.
      color3 - The color of the quad's third (bottom right) vertex.
      color4 - The color of the quad's fourth (bottom left) vertex.
      textureX - The first (top left) texture coordinate of the texture to map onto the quad.
      textureY - The first (top left) texture coordinate of the texture to map onto the quad.
      textureWidth - The width of the texture to map onto the quad.
      textureHeight - The width of the texture to map onto the quad.
      See Also:
      • Batch.canAddQuad()
